comments:
hi,
I created a sample equinox bundle that prints "hello". 
It works fine when it is started from eclipse.

But problem occurs when the osgi.jar is started from commandline.
The sample bundle gets installed and resolved.. but when i tried to start it.. it gives the error.

thanks in advance
Please attach the hello bundle jar that is failing.  My guess is that your Bundle-ClassPath is pointing to an "inner" jar that does not get included in your built bundle jar.

It does not depend on any inner jar.The thing is that i did not export it as a separate .jar.Just tried to install the plug-in project folder.
e.g
install reference:file:D:\sample\bundle1
where
bundle1  - plug-in pjt folder

It got installed and even got resolved.So i expected it to run.Why it did not?

It does not depend on any inner jar.The thing is that i did not export it as a separate .jar.Just tried to install the plug-in project folder.
e.g
install reference:file:D:\sample\bundle1
where
bundle1  - plug-in pjt folder

It got installed and even got resolved.So i expected it to run.Why it did not?

This is not valid.

PDE launches the framework in dev (using -dev <path to dev.properties>).  The dev.properties file tells the runtime additional directories to add to the bundle classpath for particular bundles in your workspace.  By default the plugin project uses the "bin" directory in your project to store built classes.  When you install a bundle manually this extra bit of information is not passed to the framework.

If you really want to do this you can use a project the uses its root directory for the source and output location of your java classes.  This way no additional "bin" directories need to be added at development time.

traces.message: The activator karbundle.Activator for bundle  karbundle is invalid
